name: ineluctably
content:
Add to word list

in a way that cannot be avoided: The success of the company is ineluctably connected with the economy in which it operates. The country seems to be moving ineluctably towards civil war.
More examplesFewer examplesThe evidence leads ineluctably to the conclusion that there was widespread corruption at the highest levels of government.Their lives were ineluctably shaped by their experiences as children.The plot moved ineluctably to its devastating climax.My eyes were ineluctably drawn to the family photographs arranged on the mantelpiece.
